{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2011}} {{Radio station | image =<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Abclocalradio.png]] -->| name = 97.3 ABC Illawarra| callsign = 2ILA| airdate = 6 March 1959 | frequency = 97.3 [[Megahertz|mHz]] [[frequency modulation|FM]] | area = [[Illawarra, New South Wales]]| owner = [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] | format = [[Talk radio|Talk]] | website = [http://www.abc.net.au/illawarra/ http://www.abc.net.au/illawarra/] | }}
'''97.3 ABC Illawarra''' is an [[ABC Local Radio]] station based in [[Wollongong, New South Wales|Wollongong]] and broadcasting to the [[Illawarra, New South Wales|Illawarra]] region in [[New South Wales]]. This includes the towns of [[Nowra, New South Wales|Nowra]], [[Shellharbour, New South Wales|Shellharbour]], [[Kiama, New South Wales|Kiama]], and [[Bowral, New South Wales|Bowral]]. The station began as '''2WN''' in 1959 originally broadcasting on the [[AM Broadcasting|AM]] band. It now transmits on the main [[FM Broadcasting|FM]] frequency of 97.3 [[Megahertz|mHz]] along with a low power FM repeater.
==Local Programs== ===Weekdays===
*Breakfast with Peter Riley â 5:30 AM to 7:45 AM *Mornings with Nick Rheinberger â 8:30 AM to 11:00 AM *Drive with Bonita Brown â 4:00 PM to 6:00 PM
===Saturday===
*Weekends with Mark Mathews â 6:00 AM to 7:45 AM and 8:30 AM to 10:00 AM
When local programs are not broadcast the station is a relay of [[702 ABC Sydney]] and [[ABC Mid North Coast]].
